means you probably have another package manager runnning

your either not launching it as root or something else is using the lock file, have you looked at the file it is complaining about
im not sure what file its complaining about. how can i find out?
please paste the EXACT error message (into a pastebin if its long)
Unable to get an exclusive lock. This usually means that another package management application (like apt-get or aptitude) already running. Please close that application first.
I suspect you have a lock file remaining
look in /var/cache/apt for a lock file
I havn't got an ubuntu box handy to check so I'm working from memory
there is 2 .bin files, and a directory called "archives"
Could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock.. Unable to lock the administration directory (/var/lib/dpkg/), is another process using it?
there we go
check for the file /var/lib/dpkg/lock
close down all your package managers and remove that file
thanks a lot. works now
